clinical_study.brief_title: A Skills-Based Program Delivered Via Videoconferencing in Patients With Acute Musculoskeletal Trauma
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial Testing a Skills-Based Program Called "A Toolkit for Optimal Recovery" Delivered Via Videoconferencing Compared to Standard Medical Care in Patients With Acute Musculoskeletal Trauma

brief_summary.textblock: The aims of this study are to test a manualized skills-building program to address mood and coping aimed at preventing the development of chronic pain and disability following acute musculoskeletal injury in at-risk patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The aims of this pilot randomized controlled trial are to compare the effect of a manualized skills-building program against usual care in preventing the development of chronic pain and disability following acute musculoskeletal injury in at-risk patients, and to test the feasibility and acceptability for delivery through live videoconferencing.

primary_outcome.description: Numerical Rating Scale (NRS) for Pain Intensity; two-item survey asking for a rating of pain intensity at rest and with activity involving injured limb/body part; each item response is considered its own score; response options range from 0-10 with higher scores indicating greater pain intensity

Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA); two scores are generated by summing items 1-34 for Function Index and 35-46 for Bothersome Index; Function Index scores range from 34-170, with higher scores indicating poorer functioning; Bothersome index scores range from 12-60, with higher scores indicating being more greatly bothered

secondary_outcome.description: Pain Catastrophizing Scale (PCS); items are summed to generate a total score; scores range from 0 to 52; higher scores indicate greater pain catastrophizing
Pain Anxiety Symptom Scale (PASS); items are summed to generate a total score; scores range from 0-100; higher sores indicate greater pain anxiety
Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (CESD); items are summed to generate a total score; scores range from 0 to 60; higher scores indicate greater depressive symptomatology
Post Traumatic Stress Disorder Checklist (PCL); items are summed to generate a total score; scores range from 17 to 85; higher scores indicate greater post traumatic stress
Retention Rate; calculated by dividing the number of participants enrolled by the number of participants that are not lost to follow up, multiplied by 100; expressed as a percentage
Client Satisfaction Questionnaire 8-Item (CSQ-8); items are summed to generate a total score; scores range from 8 to 32; higher scores indicate greater satisfaction

arm_group.arm_group_label: Toolkit for Optimal Recovery after Injury
arm_group.description: The Toolkit for Optimal Recovery after Injury (TORI) uses a multimodal approach to introduce and reinforce new skills, including didactics and in-session activities. The format is a 4-week program with weekly meetings and a focus on relaxation strategies, cognitive behavioral training, positive psychology and mind-body interactions.
The Usual Care (UC) group will continue with their current medical care.

intervention.intervention_name: The Toolkit for Optimal Recovery after Injury
intervention.description: The Toolkit for Optimal Recovery after Injury (TORI) is a comprehensive, multimodal treatment that was designed to prevent the development of chronic pain and disability following an acute musculoskeletal injury (e.g., fracture). This program is rooted in relaxation response strategies, cognitive-behavioral training, and positive psychology.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of musculoskeletal trauma
- 18 years of age or older
- English fluency and literacy
- PCS score of 13 or higher, OR, PASS score of 40 or higher
- Required to be physically located in Massachusetts
Exclusion Criteria:
- Major medical comorbidity expected to worsen in the next 6 months
- Comorbid chronic pain condition
- Antidepressant medication change in the past 6 months
- Secondary gains such as litigations or workers compensation procedures
- Diagnosis of psychosis, bipolar disorder or active substance dependence
- Unwilling or unable to use videoconferencing
